attributes.action: Regulating body for the UK video game industry
attributes.additional_details:
Why a regulating body is needed.

. Stop the release of unfinished and broken games

. A complaints procedure is in place

. Make sure the cost gaming is kept fair and affordable



The gaming industry requires a regulating body to stop the release of broken and unfinished videogames, and make sure that any multiplayer aspects of games are Beta tested months in advance of the intended release date. a body that ensure the developers and publishers keep to an agreed standard of quality when releasing a title. We need to ensure age restricted titles are no longer sold to or bought on behalf of underage teenagers and children with greater punishments for those who do. The industry requires a regulating to handle our complaints regarding any unfair procedure or underhanded conduct by a developer or publisher, a regulating body to ensure the cost of gaming remains fair and affordable.
